guest_info.name: Brad Boeye
guest_info.title: Principal
guest_info.company: Bicell Build QC with Real Broker
guest_info.production_level: Top 1% of agents in the US

main_topics: Importance of social media and branding
Navigating high interest rates and low inventory
Building a long-term career in real estate

problems_addressed.specific_problem: High interest rates and low inventory
problems_addressed.solution_summary: Educate clients on historical interest rates and the benefits of buying now before rates drop and prices rise.
Utilize social media consistently and create a logo that reflects your personal and family history in real estate.

problems_addressed.specific_problem: Staying top of mind with past clients
problems_addressed.solution_summary: Regularly engage with clients through social media, handwritten notes, and personal visits with gifts like plants.

target_avatars.relevance: The episode provides insights on leveraging personal history and social media to build a strong brand.
target_avatars.key_takeaway: Consistency in branding and client engagement can significantly boost your real estate career.

target_avatars.relevance: Offers strategies to overcome market challenges and maintain productivity.
target_avatars.key_takeaway: Focus on educating clients about market conditions and use social media to stay relevant.

clip_worthy_moments.quote: My grandmother was the very first female broker in the Quad Cities area back in 1954.
clip_worthy_moments.why_clipworthy: Highlights a pioneering story that adds depth and credibility to Brad's real estate journey.
clip_worthy_moments.suggested_hook: Discover the inspiring legacy behind a top real estate producer.

clip_worthy_moments.quote: You can't control what you can't control, like interest rates and inventory.
clip_worthy_moments.why_clipworthy: Encourages agents to focus on controllable aspects of their business.
clip_worthy_moments.suggested_hook: How to thrive in real estate despite market challenges.

key_tactics.tactic: Use social media to maintain visibility
key_tactics.context: Consistently post and engage on platforms like Facebook and Instagram to stay top of mind.
Organize annual events to strengthen relationships with past clients.
Provide historical context on interest rates to help clients make informed decisions.

quotable_insights: Longevity in real estate means something; stick with it even during tough years.
Social media is like being in a coffee shop every day; people start to recognize and trust you.

resources_mentioned.name: Real Geeks
resources_mentioned.context: Recommended as a technology partner for agents to generate more business.

resources_mentioned.name: Apply Design
resources_mentioned.context: Virtual staging solution for enhancing real estate listings.

episode_summary: In this episode, Brad Boeye shares insights on navigating the 2024 real estate market, emphasizing the importance of social media and branding. He discusses strategies for maintaining client relationships and adapting to high interest rates and low inventory. Brad's rich family history in real estate and his personal journey offer valuable lessons for agents looking to build a long-term career.
